‚Äî Tim Radtke (@TimRadtke) July 10, 2019




Very interesting presentations on forecasting, outliers, smoothing, features and time series in tidy formats by @mitchoharawild, @iSvetunkov, @robjhyndman, @pridiltal and @thiyangt at the #useR2019 pic.twitter.com/OBAujqXEYg

‚Äî Fotios Petropoulos (@fotpetr) July 12, 2019

title: PulseSpot
text:
Beyond the Floodgates: Rethinking Alert Thresholds for Effective Flood Warning Systems















No matching items

title: About
text:
I am a senior lecturer in the Department of Computational Mathematics, University of Moratuwa. I earned my PhD in statistics from Monash University, Australia, under the supervision of Professor Rob J. Hyndman and Professor Kate Smith-Miles
I‚Äôm a fellow of OWSD, a UNESCO program, from 2021 to 2025. Additionally, I co-founded R-Ladies Colombo a local chapter of the R-Ladies Global Organization which aims to promote gender diversity in the R programming community.
My research revolves around Computational Statistics, Anomaly Detection, Time series analysis and forecasting and Statistical Machine Learning. I‚Äôm passionate about developing innovative methods and tools to analyze complex data. I am also strongly committed to developing open-source software tools to facilitate reproducible research. You can check out some of my projects here: Visit me on Twitter I post mostly about R, Python, statistics, data science, and science in nature.
From 2021 to 2024, I served as an associate editor for The R Journal. I‚Äôve also contributed as an Associate Investigator at the Australian Research Council‚Äôs (ARC) Centre of Excellence for Mathematical and Statistical Frontiers (ACEMS) from 2019 to 2021.
Thiyanga Talagala,PhD in Statistics, Monash University, Australia is my sister.
